meanings.definition: The state or quality of being inefficient.
meanings.sent1: The inefficiency of the old machine caused delays in production.
meanings.sent2: The company's inefficiency in handling orders led to customer complaints.
meanings.sent3: The inefficiency of the slow-moving snail race was quite comical.
meanings.sent4: The inefficiency of the leaky bucket became apparent as water dripped out.
meanings.sent5: The inefficiency of the broken clock made it impossible to tell time accurately.

meanings.definition: The failure to achieve maximum productivity or effectiveness.
meanings.sent1: The inefficiency of the light bulb resulted in dim lighting.
meanings.sent2: The inefficiency of the team's communication caused misunderstandings.
meanings.sent3: The inefficiency of the magician's disappearing act left the audience puzzled.
meanings.sent4: The inefficiency of the rusty lock made it difficult to open the door.
meanings.sent5: The inefficiency of the leaky boat made it impossible to stay afloat.
